Title: Work Student, Product Analytics (all genders)
Description:
Join TeamViewer, the leader in remote connectivity software. We harness the potential of cutting-edge technologies such as Augmented Reality and Artificial Intelligence to push the boundaries of innovation and shape the future of digitalization.

Our team of more than 1,500 employees spans different continents, cultures and disciplines. With our inclusive values, we celebrate the unique perspectives and talents each individual brings to the table and foster a dynamic work environment where new ideas thrive.

Become part of our winning team and help us create a world that works better.

Responsibilities

Join our Product Analytics team and dive into real product usage data to help us understand how millions of customers rely on TeamViewer every day.

As a Working Student Product Analyst, you will support Product Management, Sales, and Marketing by transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive data-informed decisions across the company.


Data Extraction & Analysis: Write efficient SQL queries in BigQuery to extract and analyze complex usage data from our Remote Control product
Dashboarding: Design, build, and maintain interactive dashboards in Looker and Tableau to track KPIs such as session duration, feature adoption, and user retention
Cross-Functional Support: Translate data into clear insights for Sales and Marketing, and help Product Managers understand product usage patterns
Data Integrity: Support the team by maintaining data quality and documentation for our Single Source of Truth


Requirements


Student Status: You are currently enrolled in a university degree (Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Systems, or a similar field)
SQL Proficiency: Solid understanding of SQL (joins, aggregations, subqueries) and motivation to work in a cloud environment (BigQuery)
Visualization Skills: Initial experience or strong interest in BI tools such as Looker or Tableau
Analytical Mindset: Curiosity to understand user behavior and extract meaningful stories from datasets
Language: Fluency in English (corporate language); German is a plus but not required


What We Offer


Contract location would be Goeppingen / Berlin, Germany
Make an impact! Take on the responsibility and work on your own projects. Your passion and skills will be used in international projects and support the operations of our business!
Our Working Students in Germany receive a monthly salary of €1,566 for a 20-hour/week contract, €1,253 for a 16-hour/week contract, and €1,400 for an internship position.
Do you need to gain your first work experience as a part of a mandatory internship? Maybe you are looking for some exciting and time flexible tasks along to your studies? Join us in a role that suits you! We also offer Bachelor and Master Thesis options.
Fixed Student Contract with above average salary and trust based working hours
Make yourself at home! We don't wear ties. In our casual office atmosphere, you can wear whatever you want and enjoy your breaks in one of our many lounge areas
Hungry for knowledge? Our TeamViewer Library offers a wide range of industry-related books selections, and our E-Learning Center is available 24/7
We truly live and celebrate our cultural diversity! Our colleagues come from more than 80 countries and speak more than 40 languages
We work hard and play harder! Look forward to our company celebrations, team events and other social gatherings
No matter if you are using private or public transportation means, we offer travel subsidy to all our students
Attractive workstations with modern and ergonomic equipment, fruits, soft drinks, sports offerings and many other corporate benefits wait for you!
Our students are the potential employees of "tomorrow" - After your studies, you will have good chances of starting a full-time job


TeamViewer is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone feels welcome and supported. We C-A-R-E and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. As we continue to grow as a company, we also focus on enabling our employees to grow both personally and professionally. We are proud to have an open and embracing workplace environment that will empower you to be your best no matter your gender, civil or family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.
Show more

Our team of more than 1,500 employees spans different continents, cultures and disciplines. With our inclusive values, we celebrate the unique perspectives and talents each individual brings to the table and foster a dynamic work environment where new ideas thrive.

As a Working Student Product Analyst, you will support Product Management, Sales, and Marketing by transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive data-informed decisions across the company.

  • Data Extraction & Analysis: Write efficient SQL queries in BigQuery to extract and analyze complex usage data from our Remote Control product
  • Dashboarding: Design, build, and maintain interactive dashboards in Looker and Tableau to track KPIs such as session duration, feature adoption, and user retention
  • Cross-Functional Support: Translate data into clear insights for Sales and Marketing, and help Product Managers understand product usage patterns
  • Data Integrity: Support the team by maintaining data quality and documentation for our Single Source of Truth

  • Analytical Mindset: Curiosity to understand user behavior and extract meaningful stories from datasets
  • Language: Fluency in English (corporate language); German is a plus but not required

What We Offer

  • Make an impact! Take on the responsibility and work on your own projects. Your passion and skills will be used in international projects and support the operations of our business!
  • Our Working Students in Germany receive a monthly salary of €1,566 for a 20-hour/week contract, €1,253 for a 16-hour/week contract, and €1,400 for an internship position.

  • Our students are the potential employees of "tomorrow" - After your studies, you will have good chances of starting a full-time job

TeamViewer is an equal opportunities employer and is committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone feels welcome and supported. We C-A-R-E and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. As we continue to grow as a company, we also focus on enabling our employees to grow both personally and professionally. We are proud to have an open and embracing workplace environment that will empower you to be your best no matter your gender, civil or family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Title: IT-Administrator:in
Description:
Seit fast einem Jahrhundert zählt unser Kunde zu den weltweit führenden Unternehmen im Bereich der Präzisions- und Feinbearbeitung. Das Unternehmen entwickelt innovative Technologien für hocheffiziente Antriebssysteme und prägt die Zukunft der Automobil-, Zuliefer- sowie Luft- und Raumfahrtindustrie. Mit modernen Lösungen und einem klaren Fokus auf Qualität und Innovation setzt das Unternehmen neue Maßstäbe und gestaltet den technologischen Fortschritt aktiv mit.




Ihre Tätigkeiten:

Entgegennahme, Analyse und Bearbeitung von Störungsmeldungen im Hard- und Softwarebereich (1st, 2nd & 3rd Level Support)
Installation, Konfiguration und Betreuung von IT-Arbeitsplätzen, Peripheriegeräten und Standardsoftware
Fehleranalyse und -behebung bei Hardware-, Software- und Netzwerkproblemen – ggf. in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Dienstleistern oder Herstellern
Unterstützung bei der Administration und Wartung von Windows- und Linux-basierten Serversystemen, Virtualisierungsumgebungen, Firewalls und Netzwerkswitchen
Mitwirkung bei der kontinuierlichen Optimierung und Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden IT-Infrastruktur
Unterstützung der internen Fachbereiche bei technischen Fragestellungen und IT-Problemen
Dokumentation der Supportfälle, IT-Systeme und durchgeführten Maßnahmen




Unser Mandant erwartet:

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung im IT-Bereich (z. B. Fachinformatiker für Systemintegration) oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Gute Kenntnisse in Windows-Client- und Serversystemen, idealerweise auch Grundkenntnisse in Linux
Erfahrung mit Virtualisierung (z. B. VMware, Hyper-V) und Netzwerktechnik von Vorteil
Serviceorientierte, strukturierte und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
Freundliches Auftreten und Freude am Anwendersupport




Unser Mandant bietet:

Eine Vergütung nach dem Tarifvertrag
Mitarbeit in einem jungen und dynamischen Team mit Experten, in dem jeder
Regelmäßige, auf die Mitarbeiter zugeschnittene Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen
Diverse Sozialleistungen wie betriebliche Altersvorsorge, E-Bike-Leasing und Masseure
Firmenveranstaltungen wie Firmenlauf oder Fußballturniere
Flexible Arbeitszeiten - Gleitzeitkonto
Show more
